commit_message:
Display quotas per Cinder volume type

This patch makes Cinder volume type quotas visible in panels
related to volume creation (from volumes and images tabs).

Currently user is able to select a desired type, but if quotas are
set, there is no way to check if creating a volume is going to
succeed. With this patch two additional quota charts are displayed
so that end user can see if there is still available quota for
selected type.

This is a continued work of Mateusz Kowalski (#511472),
adapted to work with Rocky.

Closes-Bug: #1717342
Implements: blueprint quotas-per-cinder-volume-type

Change-Id: I6097f523b2ed6d9449a4b00f1c4510663da4dc7f

commit_message:
Rocky: Add missing monasca groups to inventory

Kolla is backporting all fixes for monasca to the stable/rocky branch.

This patch adds relevant groups to the inventory necessary to deploy
monasca. It should be compatible with versions kolla-ansible prior to
the monasca backport since the group changes are only additive.

We also disable grafana by default, instead use the monasca-grafana
service that is enabled automatically when monasca is enabled.

Change-Id: I35e2eb5bd96186537cfd085ecd611873bcd26801
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/03/659803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[DHCP] Don't resync network if same port is alredy in cache

Sometimes when port is created on dhcp agent's side, it may happend
that same port is already in network cache.
Before this patch if port with same IP address was already in cache,
resync was rescheduled because of duplicate IPs found in cache.

Now resync will be scheduled only if duplicate IP address belongs to
port with different MAC address or different id.

Change-Id: I23afbc10725f5dc78e3c63e6e505ef89ba8dc4a5
Closes-Bug: #1824802
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/07/658307/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Mariadb: Correct parameter name

Changed use_local_path_for_single_pod to use_local_path_for_single_pod_cluster
in values.yaml. It was a bug

commit_message:
Point to OSH-images images

We now have a process for OSH-images image building,
using Zuul, so we should point the images by default to those
images, instead of pointing to stale images.

Without this, the osh-images build process is completely not
in use (and completely opaque to deployers), and updating the
osh-images process or patching its code has no impact on OSH.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: Ic00bd98c151669dc2485cd88e0e8c2ab05445959

subject: Make 'destination' optional for live migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-21 16:50:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/df10d4b89d90e07b3226a0c5204a7bd14b9bb54c', 'message': "Make 'destination' optional for live migration

You don't need to supply a destination host when live migrating and if
you don't nova will pick one for you. Enable this use case through some
command line foo.

Note that this is currently broken due to a bug in argparse [1]. We're
going to need to vendor yet more of argparse in cliff and resolve that
before this will work. The alternative I explored was making '--live' a
simple boolean flag and adding a second positional argument, but that
means either (a) we break things for users currently running something
like 'server migrate --live dest source' (dest and source would not be
swapped) or (b) we end up with an unintuitive command where the
destination positional argument comes before source positional and we'd
still break commands like 'server migrate --live dest --foo source'.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue9338

Change-Id: I5d06ebac81c409cef244352f46ebde9c0b74aea9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make 'destination' optional for live migration

You don't need to supply a destination host when live migrating and if
you don't nova will pick one for you. Enable this use case through some
rather ugly hackery. Note that this solution was chosen after other
attempts were brought down by bugs in argparse [1].

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue9338

Change-Id: I5d06ebac81c409cef244352f46ebde9c0b74aea9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1411190

commit_message:
Remove null root provider protections

A when root providers were added, a series of TODOs were
left in allocation candidate and resource provider data
handling. These TODOs should be removed once we are assured
that there are no null roots. That is the case now, given
that we had an online migration and a status check and now
(prior to this patch) there is a blocker migration and the
status check is an error instead of warning.

The release note for the change of the status check should
suffice for covering this. That is: it makes what it says,
True.

Story: 2005613
Task: 30860
Change-Id: I84baff29505550f3f20069ad5817784d0d1aaea6

commit_message:
Remove rootwrap configuration from neutron-keepalived-state-change

New IP command introduced by Ie3fe825d65408fc969c478767b411fe0156e9fbc
requires only privsep initialization. This patch removes the prisep
error FailedToDropPrivileges when executed under neutron-rootwrap.

Closes-Bug: #1823038

Change-Id: I6cde3c9dae7ffdccce49e88c3c79d1c379f291cf
(cherry picked from commit aacd11ab9f8f24291f369d23662b0cb6b3fe43e3)

commit_message:
Remove rootwrap configuration from neutron-keepalived-state-change

New IP command introduced by Ie3fe825d65408fc969c478767b411fe0156e9fbc
requires only privsep initialization. This patch removes the prisep
error FailedToDropPrivileges when executed under neutron-rootwrap.

Closes-Bug: #1823038

Change-Id: I6cde3c9dae7ffdccce49e88c3c79d1c379f291cf
(cherry picked from commit aacd11ab9f8f24291f369d23662b0cb6b3fe43e3)

commit_message:
Use a hash for lock names

Some tooz drivers do not support long lock names. For example, mysql locks must
be 64 characters at most. This hashes the lock name in order to fix the lock
name length.

Change-Id: I5f058ea1197f5c2ba062a9bc0b67c509c8252852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/39/660939/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import hashlib name = hashlib.sha256( ("cloudkitty-" + str(tenant_id + '-') + str(CONF.collect.collector + '-') + str(CONF.fetcher.backend + '-') + str(CONF.collect.scope_key)).encode('ascii')).hexdigest()
deleted_lines: name = b"cloudkitty-" \ + str(tenant_id + '-').encode('ascii') \ + str(CONF.collect.collector + '-').encode('ascii') \ + str(CONF.fetcher.backend + '-').encode('ascii') \ + str(CONF.collect.scope_key).encode('ascii') LOG.debug('Acquired lock "{}".'.format(lock_name))

commit_message:
Cap bandit for stable/stein

Cap bandit in test-requirements.txt for stable/stein release
instead of blacklisting 1.6.0, that way we always use a known
good version from when stable/stein was created.

Change-Id: Ib287e0ade45c3ea1023f75da9f748ad9873436a7

subject: [DNM] Populate key_pairs from top_cell to child cells
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-05-09 11:09:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2ee84291593eda330fbf3f56583161e231cb2d50', 'message': '[DNM] Populate key_pairs from top_cell to child cells

This patch adds a keypair migration tool to repopulate missing
keypairs in the child cells by reading the correspoding records
from cell00 (the top cell in cells_v1).

This patch might be required for operators to migrate from cells_v1 to
cells_v2 if they face a situation where keypairs are missing in
the instance_extra tables of their child cells in case they were
running cells_v1 when the newton ``instance_obj.migrate_instance_keypairs``
migration was run.

Change-Id: I2d73976916e05a0ef722384244dbc9af7a16b466
Closes-Bug: #1761197
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-05-09 11:13:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/050060a57491641e1885b85fa310c38b13dbb464', 'message': '[DNM] Populate key_pairs from top_cell to child cells

from cell00 (the top cell in cells_v1).

This patch might be required for operators to migrate from cells_v1 to
cells_v2 if they face a situation where keypairs are missing in
the instance_extra tables of their child cells in case they were
running cells_v1 when the newton ``instance_obj.migrate_instance_keypairs``
migration was run.

Note that the top_api_context_manager targets the cells_v2 mother DB
while main_context_manager targets the child cells.

FYI: Its an ugly fix and hence the DNM.

Change-Id: I2d73976916e05a0ef722384244dbc9af7a16b466
Closes-Bug: #1761197

commit_message:
[DNM] Populate key_pairs from top_cell to child cells

This patch adds a keypair migration tool to repopulate missing
keypairs in the child cells by reading the correspoding records
from cell00 (the top cell in cells_v1).

This patch might be required for operators to migrate from cells_v1 to
cells_v2 if they face a situation where keypairs are missing in
the instance_extra tables of their child cells in case they were
running cells_v1 when the newton ``instance_obj.migrate_instance_keypairs``
migration was run.

Note that the top_api_context_manager targets the cells_v1 mother DB
while main_context_manager targets the child cells.

FYI: Its an ugly fix and hence the DNM.

Change-Id: I2d73976916e05a0ef722384244dbc9af7a16b466
Closes-Bug: #1761197

added_lines: # CERN from sqlalchemy.orm import undefer # CERN# CERN @db_api.top_api_context_manager.reader def _comparision_by_uuids(ctxt, instance_uuid): top_db_extra = ctxt.session.query(models.InstanceExtra).\ options(undefer('keypairs')).\ options(undefer('vcpu_model')).\ filter(models.InstanceExtra.instance_uuid == instance_uuid).first() if not top_db_extra: LOG.error(('This instance extra record was not found in cell00: %s.'), instance_uuid) top_db_extra = models.InstanceExtra() top_db_extra.keypairs = jsonutils.dumps( objects.KeyPairList(context=ctxt).obj_to_primitive()) return top_db_extra @db_api.main_context_manager.writer def _repopulate_missing_kps(ctxt, count): db_extras = ctxt.session.query(models.InstanceExtra).\ options(joinedload('instance')).\ filter_by(keypairs=None).\ filter_by(deleted=0).\ limit(count).\ all() count_all = len(db_extras) count_hit = 0 for db_extra in db_extras: if db_extra.instance is None: LOG.error( ('Instance %(uuid)s has been purged, but an instance_extra ' 'record remains for it. Unable to migrate.'), {'uuid': db_extra.instance_uuid}) continue instance_uuid = db_extra.instance_uuid top_db_extra = _comparision_by_uuids(ctxt, instance_uuid) db_extra.keypairs = top_db_extra.keypairs db_extra.save(ctxt.session) count_hit += 1 return count_all, count_hit def repopulate_missing_kps(ctxt, count): return _repopulate_missing_kps(ctxt, count) # CERN

Added the ability to change the segmentation ID of a network
with ports bound to OVS agent. The rules, both in the integration
bridge and the physical bridge, to convert the internal VLAN tag
and the external segmentation ID (external VLAN tag) are deleted
and created again with the new value. The traffic from the tenant
networks will be tagged then with the new segmentation ID.

Added get network details agent RPC call to retrieve the information
of the updated network.

Partial-Bug: #1806052

Change-Id: I69f6f3ef717c3ed40218099b1f389afd3d39bd62

with ports bound to OVS agent. The rules, both in the integration
bridge and the physical bridge, to convert the internal VLAN tag
and the external segmentation ID (external VLAN tag) are deleted

commit_message:
Change provider network segmentation ID in OVS agent

Added the ability to change the segmentation ID of a network
with ports bound to OVS agent. The rules, both in the integration
bridge and the physical bridge, to convert the internal VLAN tag
and the external segmentation ID (external VLAN tag) are deleted
and created again with the new value. The traffic from the tenant
networks will be tagged then with the new segmentation ID.

Added get network details agent RPC call to retrieve the information
of the updated network.

Partial-Bug: #1806052

Change-Id: I69f6f3ef717c3ed40218099b1f389afd3d39bd62

commit_message:
Get rid of lookup utils

With the new joining mechanism lookup utils for task executions
become useless and can be removed from the codebase.
Now all requests to the database will be perforemed directly from
a workflow controller.

Action defention cache was moved to mistral/engine/actions.py,
because it's needed only there.

Change-Id: If0d4403f5c61883ecfec4cfa14b98cc39aae5618

commit_message:
Allow to add env files to overcloud deploy script

In order to be able to manage new services added in new releases, like
CinderBackendPure when upgrading from 13 to 14, we need the ability
to enable services by adding the corresponding env file prior
to performing upgrade.

Change-Id: Ibc9be8841334c7d707e042030ef18a1b6c9caeba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/53/659553/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
standalone/undercloud - post: use EndpointMap to fetch Keystone URL

Using EndpointMap to ensure we get the hostname/fqdn if possible
otherwise it fallbacks to the IP for Keystone public endpoint.

This is useful when the operator uses a certificate based on
hostname/fqdn and not an IP address.

Closes-Bug #1763776
Change-Id: Ifa9d55cca90caf5be0c83507cb47447e25311fce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/22/655822/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. type: json # if SSL is enabled we use the public virtual ip/hostname/fqdn as the stackrc endpoint # Using EndpointMap to ensure we get the hostname/fqdn if possible # otherwise it fallbacks to the IP. It depends which environment # was loaded and this logic resides in tripleoclient. scheme: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystonePublic, protocol]} host: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystonePublic, host]} port: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystonePublic, port]} # Using EndpointMap to ensure we get the hostname/fqdn if possible # otherwise it fallbacks to the IP. subject: Service Function Chaining API Reference
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 22:58:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/1e2dac3eb6e8b2c15631e2a37044c61f910e09c8', 'message': 'Service Function Chaining API Reference

This commit copies the Service Function Chaining API documentation from
the networking-sfc repository to the neutron-lib repository and
disambiguates the parameter names.

This commit also adds section heading (similar to how the Nova API-Ref
is formatted) because SFC includes four categories of API calls that
should be grouped together logically.

the networking-sfc repository to the neutron-lib repository and

commit_message:
Service Function Chaining API Reference

This commit copies the Service Function Chaining API documentation from
the networking-sfc repository to the neutron-lib repository and
disambiguates the parameter names.

Change-Id: I938b50ff6ff6aa50cfa87ae90e9295fd58f60dae
Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang <cathy.zhang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Louis Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>

subject: Fix rbd driver json loading
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-16 11:09:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3dff825498618acd65c4e1cc6c2e9eeda0344779', 'message': 'Fix rbd driver with Python 3

The json from ceph must go through .decode("UTF-8"), otherwise we get a
JSON object must be str, not 'bytes' error.

Change-Id: I5cdb4e766655a866699a18f1e367971fd1d310af
Closes-Bug: #1771552
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-16 11:57:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/ef79269f91d0e646991ed003040663dfdbd1c34b', 'message': 'Fix rbd driver json loading

It looks like rbd.py sometimes gets some bytes, not strings, probably
this happens with the latest version of Ceph, and that's an issue only
with Python 3. I'm not sure why, but what I know, is that it's completely
breaking Debian with Python 3 and ceph Luminous release.

So, this patch first tests the json buffer comming from Ceph, and if it
isn't a string, it calls .decode("UTF-8").

Change-Id: I5cdb4e766655a866699a18f1e367971fd1d310af
Closes-Bug: #1771552
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-05-16 12:19:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/0cd8f83cfb611c97e1119e6d5a6ebc09155e1fb7', 'message': 'Fix rbd driver json loading

this happens with the latest version of Ceph, and that's an issue only
with Python 3. I'm not sure why, but what I know, is that it's completely
breaking Debian with Python 3 and ceph Luminous release.

So, this patch first tests the json buffer comming from Ceph, and if it
isn't a string, it calls .decode("UTF-8").

Change-Id: I5cdb4e766655a866699a18f1e367971fd1d310af
Closes-Bug: #1771552
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-16 18:38:44.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d156030338ba10980b85704602e5085fffb32124', 'message': "Fix rbd driver json loading

It looks like rbd.py sometimes gets some bytes, not strings, probably
this happens with the latest version of Ceph, and that's an issue only
with Python 3. I'm not sure why, but what I know, is that it's completely
breaking Debian with Python 3 and ceph Luminous release.

Convert byte buffers coming from Ceph to strings.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5cdb4e766655a866699a18f1e367971fd1d310af
Closes-Bug: #1771552
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rbd driver json loading

It looks like rbd.py sometimes gets some bytes, not strings, probably
this happens with the latest version of Ceph, and that's an issue only
with Python 3. I'm not sure why, but what I know, is that it's completely
breaking Debian with Python 3 and ceph Luminous release.

Convert byte buffers coming from Ceph to strings.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5cdb4e766655a866699a18f1e367971fd1d310af
Closes-Bug: #1771552

to oooq based upgrade job (for composable upgrade)

subject: Docs: Improve vpnaas scenario
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-05-23 11:24:56.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/vpnaas-scenario.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8b2201aef499fcca821b619b146c632d3dd523b0', 'message': 'Docs: Improve vpnaas scenario

Sometimes Linux service ipsec not running will cause
ipsec pluto not working, as a result Neutron VPN service
not works as expect.

Add a note for check ipsec service before using VPN service.

Change-Id: I8219c5fb86ae79850e2c4bfe1b95d61dfad6552e
'}]
commit_message:
Docs: Improve vpnaas scenario

Sometimes Linux service ipsec not running will cause
ipsec pluto not working, as a result Neutron VPN service
not works as expect.

Add a note for check ipsec service before using VPN service.

Change-Id: I8219c5fb86ae79850e2c4bfe1b95d61dfad6552e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/78/660978/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Make sure that the Linux system service ``ipsec`` running normally while using ``StrongSwanDriver`` or ``LibreSwanDriver`` as vpn_device_driver.

subject: metadata: Resync agent when misconfiguration is detected
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-24 09:38:08.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/agent/metadata/agent.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_metadata_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/2037bfe5626c8d451786feae879cfb7aa80c8123', 'message': "metadata: Resync agent when misconfiguration is detected

In case of migration, the metadata agent is kept running with old
br-migration bridge cached in agent's attribute.  Everything else is
configured correctly but agent still uses old value.  This patch adds a
resync mechanism that's triggered by PortBindingChassisEvent in case
agent fails to use currently cached bridge and the bridge doesn't exist

Closes-bug: #1824984
Change-Id: Ia17ad3476e61a729136622b4356ce59234ab023a

commit_message:
metadata: Resync agent when misconfiguration is detected

In case of migration, the metadata agent is kept running with old
br-migration bridge cached in agent's attribute.  Everything else is
configured correctly but agent still uses old value.  This patch adds a
resync mechanism that's triggered by PortBindingChassisEvent in case
agent fails to use currently cached bridge and the bridge doesn't exist
on the system.

Closes-bug: #1824984
Change-Id: Ia17ad3476e61a729136622b4356ce59234ab023a

commit_message:
Use openstack-tox-docs for api-* jobs

Rebase build-api-* jobs on openstack-tox-docs so that teams
can control environment, similar to what we did for openstack-tox-docs.

The repos using the build-api jobs have already a tox.ini environment
set up, so no changes needed for these repos.

This is one step in phasing out build-sphinx jobs.

Change-Id: I2dc873739755cf68ff68bcbb4504db2c76507f53

WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslotest import base from mock import Mock class TestUtils(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestUtils, self).setUp() from monasca_persister.repositories import utils self.utils = utils self.message = Mock() def tearDown(self): super(TestUtils, self).tearDown() def test_parse_measurement_message(self): self.message.message.value = """{ "metric": { "name": "metric_name", "timestamp": "metric_timestamp", "value": "0.0", "value_meta": { }, "dimensions": {} }, "meta": { "region": "meta_region", "tenantId": "meta_tenantId" } }""" data = self.utils.parse_measurement_message(self.message) self.assertEqual(data[0], {}) self.assertEqual(data[1], 'metric_name') self.assertEqual(data[2], 'meta_region') self.assertEqual(data[3], 'meta_tenantId') self.assertEqual(data[4], 'metric_timestamp') self.assertEqual(data[5], float('0.0')) self.assertEqual(data[6], {}) def test_parse_alarm_state_hist_message(self): self.message.message.value = """{ "alarm-transitioned": { "alarmId": "dummyid", "metrics": "dummymetrics", "newState": "dummynewState", "oldState": "dummyoldState", "link": "dummylink", "lifecycleState": "dummylifecycleState", "stateChangeReason": "dummystateChangeReason", "tenantId": "dummytenantId", "timestamp": "dummytimestamp", "subAlarms": { "subAlarmExpression": "dummy_sub_alarm", "currentValues": "dummy_values", "metricDefinition": "dummy_definition", "subAlarmState": "dummy_state" } } }""" data = self.utils.parse_alarm_state_hist_message(self.message) self.assertEqual(data[0], 'dummyid') self.assertEqual(data[1], 'dummymetrics') self.assertEqual(data[2], 'dummynewState') self.assertEqual(data[3], 'dummyoldState') self.assertEqual(data[4], 'dummylink') self.assertEqual(data[5], 'dummylifecycleState') self.assertEqual(data[6], "dummystateChangeReason") self.assertEqual(data[7], '{"sub_alarm_expression":"dummy_sub_alarm",' '"current_values":"dummy_values","metric_definition":' '"dummy_definition","sub_alarm_state":"dummy_state"}') self.assertEqual(data[8], 'dummytenantId') self.assertEqual(data[9], 'dummytimestamp') def test_parse_events_message(self): self.message.message.value = """{ "event": { "event_type": "dummy_event_type", "timestamp": "dummy_timestamp", "payload": "dummy_payload", "dimensions": "dummy_dimensions" }, "meta": { "project_id": "dummy_project_id" } }""" project_id, timestamp, event_type, payload, dimensions = \ self.utils.parse_events_message(self.message) self.assertEqual(project_id, "dummy_project_id") self.assertEqual(timestamp, "dummy_timestamp") self.assertEqual(event_type, "dummy_event_type") self.assertEqual(payload, "dummy_payload") self.assertEqual(dimensions, "dummy_dimensions")

commit_message:
Pass correct arguments to six.reraise

six.reraise input arguments are:
  six.reraise(exc_type, exc_value, exc_traceback=None)

This information is provided by sys.exc_info() and stored
in self.communication_error.

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: Ibe68d8e36ca424da61a0a9eea20e622440c79464

commit_message:
Make sure to set umask 022 for nova_migration_target logins

On RHEL8 copy files for cold/live migration useing SSH in
nova_migration_target container use the wrong umask. With this
change we make sure to use 022 as umask in the nova_migration_target
container.

Closes-bug: #1829996

Change-Id: I354f153394009591e38773d0afc933ce38a8fdff
(cherry picked from commit 8ff689bc835836799fe4b51522aa2beb9d125cad)

commit_message:
Add blocker alembic migration for null root_provider_ids

This adds an alembic migration script which will block a db_sync
if the online data migration has not been run.

Change-Id: I74c49d286dfc62f49af24303ed1cb18489e7e89d
Story: 2005613
Task: 30921

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Block on null root_provider_id Revision ID: 611cd6dffd7b Revises: b4ed3a175331 Create Date: 2019-05-09 13:57:04.874293 """ from alembic import context import sqlalchemy as sa from sqlalchemy import func as sqlfunc from sqlalchemy import MetaData, Table, select # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '611cd6dffd7b' down_revision = 'b4ed3a175331' branch_labels = None depends_on = None def upgrade(): connection = context.get_bind() metadata = MetaData(bind=connection) resource_providers = Table('resource_providers', metadata, autoload=True) query = select([sqlfunc.count()]).select_from(resource_providers).where( resource_providers.c.root_provider_id == sa.null()) if connection.scalar(query): raise Exception('There is at least one resource provider table ' 'record which misses its root provider id. commit_message:
Change "Missing Root Provider IDs" upgrade check to a failure

We want to drop the REST API compability code for resource
providers with no root_provider_id in Train, so to start
we should make the related upgrade check a failure rather
than a warning.

Change-Id: Ifd3c84ea3348fc9e6653838d6fba4a5eb864f01e
Story: 2005613
Task: 30921

commit_message:
Ignore config-samples and policy sample file in git

Sphinx generates files and directories like:
doc/source/_static/config-samples/
doc/source/_static/neutron.policy.yaml.sample

when is building docs pages.
Those files should be ignored in git and this patch adds it
to the .gitignore file.

Change-Id: I42d358bf062f3bcb2809fd762773246186ca4482

commit_message:
Set arp_notify to match ndisc_notify

A previous change [1] enabled ndisc_notify, which is the IPv6 equivalent
for IPv4's arp_notify.  Enable the latter to keep them consistent with
each other.

Change-Id: I15e8348585a9c0ee824a4c123677992010980b9e
Related-Bug: #1827927
(cherry picked from commit f3df90f2c0afa352d4dcf14463a9364c9080afe6)

commit_message:
Download and define base image if configured

When we build the image we need a base image to be defined.
For CentOS it's done automatically in client, but if we need to
build something else we need to download it and define it
explicitly.
base_image_url - URL of base image
base_image_path - path to save it on host

Change-Id: I10bd9868fcfd3a4d5992fc7d7b6200e908e75e25

commit_message:
Update description of valid whitelist for non-admin user

Non-admin user can filter instance by instance-uuid and other
filter keys with being configured using the "os_compute_api:
servers:allow_all_filters" policy rule. The policy rule was
added with Ia5504da9a00bad689766aeda20255e10b7629f63.

Closes-Bug:1819425

Change-Id: I74146b4370b6017cb199466258165fc6df080082

commit_message:
Fix devstack plugin python3 support

The octavia-dashboard devstack plugin.sh script was calling
"python". This causes the plugin to fail on python3 only hosts.
This patch corrects this by using the devstack $PYTHON variable.

Change-Id: I18bc3ce532e163acc1d49daa84cd7c7495dbc777
Story: 2005761
Task: 33469

commit_message:
Windows: avoid passing conf objects to subprocesses

On Windows, cotyledon uses multiprocessing instead of forking. Meanwhile,
config objects as well as service manager objects aren't pickleable.

For this reason, we'll avoid passing unpickleable objects to subprocesses,
making all the required initialization on the subprocess side.

This change will allow ceilometer-polling to run on Windows.

Change-Id: Id51db8f06f295bb7019915b53e560df52456cbda
Closes-Bug: #1625602

added_lines: import os def _prepare_config(): return conf def create_polling_service(worker_id, conf=None): if conf is None: conf = _prepare_config() conf.log_opt_values(LOG, log.DEBUG) return manager.AgentManager(worker_id, conf) def main(): # On Windows, we can only initialize conf objects in the subprocess. # As a consequence, we can't use oslo_config_glue.setup() on Windows, # because cotyledon.ServiceManager objects are not picklable. if os.name == 'nt': sm.add(create_polling_service) else: conf = _prepare_config() oslo_config_glue.setup(sm, conf) sm.add(create_polling_service, args=(conf,))

commit_message:
Fix format file message field

The message field for these format files wasn't renamed when
the input field was renamed. This problem was masked by Monasca
which renames the message field back to 'message' for the Fluentd
Monasca output plugin.

Change-Id: I2674958b1e64efddbca4765fefa55431261648e6
Closes-Bug: #1819168

commit_message:
Fix build-api-* jobs

In [0] the sphinx_build_dir was mistakenly removed, but we need to keep
it in order for the fetch-sphinx-output role to collect the build output
from the correct location.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/659975

Change-Id: I70e9c0e0311228fd90a593f165278b8d02b08b69

commit_message:
Add ability to provide qos_policy_id for port

Neutron API supports qos_policy defenition during port creation and
port object already contains qos_policy_id[1]
So this patch extends port_update method with the ability to provide
qos_policy_id in the addition to existing parameters.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/branch/master/openstack/network/v2/port.py#L109

Change-Id: Iad837fababa8d9d0c604637d326b1b1253f13c05

commit_message:
Add support for vendor hooks

Add possibility to pass a hook in the vendor config, clouds-public.* or 
upon building a connection. This should be a string parameter - function
name to be executed. This gives possibility to register new services of 
the cloud automatically or alter behavior of the present services.
It would have not been necessary, if public clouds followed 
upstream-first aproach.

While we are here fix warnings on not closed files in the test_json

Change-Id: Ifd6c0847102af4f46e361dcb1a665829c77553b9

commit_message:
baremetal: allow updating name and extra fields of an allocation

Support for this was introduced in Bare Metal API 1.57 (Train).

Change-Id: I4885d9a710cd6697c241bb1962dbbe2741a049a1
Story: #2005126
Task: #29798

test_allocation_update(self): name = 'ossdk-name1' allocation = self.create_allocation(resource_class=self.resource_class) allocation = self.conn.baremetal.wait_for_allocation(allocation) self.assertEqual('active', allocation.state) self.assertIsNone(allocation.last_error) self.assertIsNone(allocation.name) self.assertEqual({}, allocation.extra) allocation = self.conn.baremetal.update_allocation( allocation, name=name, extra={'answer': 42}) self.assertEqual(name, allocation.name) self.assertEqual({'answer': 42}, allocation.extra) allocation = self.assertIsNone(allocation.last_error) self.assertIsNone(allocation.name) self.assertEqual({}, allocation.extra) allocation = self.conn.baremetal.patch_allocation( allocation, [{'op': 'replace', self.conn.baremetal.get_allocation(name) self.assertEqual(name, allocation.name) self.assertEqual({'answer': 42}, allocation.extra) allocation = self.conn.baremetal.patch_allocation( allocation, [{'op': 'remove', 'path': '/name'}, {'op': 'remove', 'path': '/extra/answer'}]) self.assertIsNone(allocation.name) self.assertEqual({}, allocation.extra) allocation = self.conn.baremetal.get_allocation(allocation.id) self.assertIsNone(allocation.name) self.assertEqual({}, allocation.extra) self.conn.baremetal.delete_allocation(allocation, ignore_missing=False) self.assertRaises(exceptions.ResourceNotFound, self.conn.baremetal.get_allocation, allocation.id)

commit_message:
Update docs job

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs are obsolete since some time,
use the newer build-openstack-docs-pti jobs instead using a template.

Also, update tox.ini to use sphinx-build following PTI.

Switch to openstackdocstheme, since oslosphinx is dead.

Use doc/requirements.txt for doc jobs.

Fix doc building errors.

Remove now obsolete sections from setup.cfg

Change-Id: I311c4037a2c3a3ad0c17718d32d638c63fada3c7
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/660562

commit_message:
Cleanup doc dependencies

This creates a dedicated doc/requirements.txt for doc-only
dependencies like sphinx packages so we can decouple those
from the test-requirements.txt.

As a result, the missing oslo.serialization runtime dependency
is added (I used the same version that python-novaclient uses).

Due to change If558f184c959e4b63b56dec3ca1571d1034cfe5c in the
openstack/requirements repo, in order to pass the
requirements-check job we have to specify both the py27 and py3
versions for sphinx.

Change-Id: I8bc3330a456f8bb76a17c4277a094a64fe9be449

commit_message:
Add retag tripleo-ci-testing for promotion jobs

For periodic OVB jobs looks like we also need to retag with
tripleo-ci-testing and not only the delorean hash. We removed this
in [1] but it seems it might still be required. See related comment
at [2] when this was originally removed (about OVB).

After containers are built, if periodic, fetch the containers by
hash and then tag & push with 'tripleo-ci-testing'

[1] https://review.opendev.org/642662
[2] dhttps://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1819583
Related-Bug: 1829976

Change-Id: Ia4da9ad371a0f6f6db4ce589bc07e1f59b9a611b

Add CI trigger for ceph jobs

Add a trigger for running CI ceph jobs when docker/ceph/.* and
docker/cinder/.* files are being changed.

commit_message:
WIP healthcheck: revert timer interval to 30s to fix AMQP healthchecks

With the docker container engine, healthchecks were run every 30s
which ensured that services running under mod_wsgi would always
wake up on time to acknowledge any AMQP healthcheck packet sent
by rabbitmq.

Currently the default podman is 60s + random(45)s, which is too high
to always acknowledge AMQP heartbeats on time.

Revert the healthcheck interval to 30s + random(5)s to mimick what
we had in Rocky and below.

Also use AccuracySec=1us because by default it's set to 1m so
systemd would not wake up often enough to honour 30s timers.

Change-Id: I4e5ce0b40a476f2077549d0b32b83de88f6aaa3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/paunch refs/changes/86/655586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Specify pickle protocol in REPLICATE()

The default pickle protocol in python3 is version 3. This is not
readable by a python2 interpreter.

Force the use of version 2 in the object server REPLICATE() function,
for compatibility with python 2.

Change-Id: I19d23570ff3a084d288de1308e059cfd8134d6ad

commit_message:
Add operator tool to async-delete some or all objects in a container

Adds a tool, swift-container-deleter, that takes an account/container
and optional prefix, marker, and/or end-marker; spins up an internal
client; makes listing requests against the container; and pushes the
found objects into the object-expirer queue with a special
application/async-deleted content-type.

In order to do this enqueuing efficiently, a new internal-to-the-cluster
container method is introduced: UPDATE. It takes a JSON list of object
entries and runs them through merge_items.

The object-expirer is updated to look for work items with this
content-type and skip the X-If-Deleted-At check that it would normally
do.

Note that the target-container's listing will continue to show the
objects until data is actually deleted, bypassing some of the concerns
raised in the related change about clearing out a container entirely and
then deleting it.

Change-Id: Ia13ee5da3d1b5c536eccaadc7a6fdcd997374443
Related-Change: I50e403dee75585fc1ff2bb385d6b2d2f13653cf8

commit_message:
Fix a typo and add troubleshooting in tools README

It was discovered that the example paths included in the README.rst
used monasca-persister rather than monasca_persister.

Also added a footnote with two error messages that occur when the
contact_points is not specified correctly.

Story: 2005305
Task: 30611

Change-Id: I0c53af817504e638bd82401ca0b62874cb591f36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-persister refs/changes/81/659681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `/opt/stack/venv/monasca-<version>/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monasca_persister` or as in devstack `/opt/stack/monasca-persister/monasca_persister/`. java deployment, it may be in `/opt/stack/service/monasca/etc/persister-config.yml` or in devstack `/etc/monasca/persister.conf` particularly the password. - The single IP for the management network of one of the Cassandra nodes should be given for the contact_points value, rather than the list of hostnames as specified in the .yml. [#f1]_ cp persister-*-metric-id.py /opt/stack/venv/monasca-<version>/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monasca_persister.. [#f1] Using the wrong format locator for the contact_points may result in errors: - Giving the wrong IP address: :: NoHostAvailable: ('Unable to connect to any servers', {'192.168.0.0': error(111, "Tried connecting to [('192.168.0.0', 9042)]. Last error: Connection refused")}) - Giving a hostname rather than IP: :: gaierror: [Errno -2] Name or service not known limitations under the License.
deleted_lines: `/opt/stack/venv/monasca-<version>/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monasca-persister` or as in devstack `/opt/stack/monasca-persister/monasca_persister/`. java deployment, it may be in `/opt/stack/service/monasca/etc/persister-config.yml` or in devstack `/etc/monasca/persister.conf` particularly the password. In some cases, the single IP for the management network of one of the Cassandra nodes may need to be given, rather than the list of hostnames as specified in the .yml. cp persister-*-metric-id.py /opt/stack/venv/monasca-<version>/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monasca-persisterlimitations under the License.
